primary_deity.name: Lord Vaidyanath
primary_deity.meaning: Lord of Physicians, the Divine Healer who cures all ailments of body and soul

mythology.origin_story: Ravana, the mighty king of Lanka, performed fierce penance to obtain Shiva's blessing. When Shiva seemed unmoved, Ravana began severing his own heads as offerings. Moved by this extreme devotion, Shiva appeared, healed all ten heads, and became known as Vaidyanath—the Divine Physician. Though Ravana was granted his boon, the lingam was destined to remain at Deoghar.
mythology.cosmic_significance: Vaidyanath represents Shiva's compassionate, healing aspect. While Shiva is often portrayed as the transformer through destruction, here he appears as the physician who restores wholeness. This Jyotirlinga teaches that divine grace transcends moral judgment—even Ravana received healing through sincere devotion.

sacred_mantras.name: Vaidyanath Dhyana Mantra
sacred_mantras.meaning: Salutations to the Lord of Physicians
sacred_mantras.benefit: Invokes divine healing energy for physical ailments, mental disturbances, and spiritual diseases

sacred_mantras.name: Maha Mrityunjaya Mantra
sacred_mantras.sanskrit: ॐ त्र्यम्बकं यजामहे सुगन्धिं पुष्टिवर्धनम् उर्वारुकमिव बन्धनान्मृत्योर्मुक्षीय माऽमृतात्
sacred_mantras.benefit: Especially powerful at Vaidyanath for healing terminal illnesses and protecting from untimely death
